calc.model

Class StandardCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • calc.model.StandardCalc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CalcInterface

    public class StandardCalc
extends java.lang.Object
implements CalcInterface
    The StandardCalc class is used to evaluate infix expression strings, by implementing the Shunting Algorithm. This converts an infix expression to postfix, then the postfix string is passed to a RevPolishCalc object which evaluates the answer for this class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alex Cordaro ZDAC051

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StandardCalc()
      Constructs a StandardCalc object, initialising objects of RevPolishCalc, OpStack and StrStack.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String convertToPostfix(StrStack infixTokens)
      This method uses Dijkstra's Shunting Algorithm to convert an infix expression to a post expression.
      float evaluate(java.lang.String expression)
      The evaluate method breaks an infix string down into tokens, on a StrStack object, before passing it to the convertToPostfix() method.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • convertToPostfix

        public java.lang.String convertToPostfix(StrStack infixTokens)
                                  throws BadTypeException,
                                         EmptyStackException,
                                         InvalidExpressionException
        This method uses Dijkstra's Shunting Algorithm to convert an infix expression to a post expression.
        Parameters:
        infixTokens - a StrStack object containing the infix expression tokens
        Returns:
        an equivalent postfix string
        Throws:
        BadTypeException - the wrong getter for an Entry type is called
        EmptyStackException - either strStack or opStack are already empty
        InvalidExpressionException - the infix string is not a valid mathematical expression

      • evaluate

        public float evaluate(java.lang.String expression)
               throws InvalidExpressionException,
                      BadTypeException,
                      EmptyStackException
        The evaluate method breaks an infix string down into tokens, on a StrStack object, before passing it to the convertToPostfix() method. The returned string is then evaluated by the RevPolishCalc object, in order for this method to return the answer.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface CalcInterface
        Parameters:
        expression - an infix expression string
        Returns:
        the answer to the expression
        Throws:
        BadTypeException - the wrong getter for an Entry type is called
        EmptyStackException - either strStack or opStack are already empty
        InvalidExpressionException - the infix or postfix string is not a valid mathematical expression
